snippet: We’re pretending that adults make healthy food choices. But they don’t.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Dr Thomas A Farley argues focus on lowering obesity rates in young children while putting comparatively little effort into helping adults is setting stage for future failures; says while effort is laudable, assumption that good habits in childhood will be lifelong is incorrect; notes obesity epidemic is characterized mostly by adult weight gain; contends main task it to fight against marketing of unhealthy foods to all segments of population.
lead_paragraph: We’re pretending that adults make healthy food choices. But they don’t.

headline.print_headline: Fighting Obesity Is Not Just for Kids
headline.main: The Problem With Focusing on Childhood Obesity
